title: Bankruptcy in CA. Will CAL. CCP. CODE ยง 704.160 completely exempt a lump sum that I received as the result of Workers Comp case
question: I just received a check for $40k, but still need to file chapter 7. I will be in 704 b/c I have some equity.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy means test,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Workers' compensation
answers: Using 704 exemptions maximizes your RE equity exemption amount, but you lose the valuable wildcard. Contact me or any AVVO BK lawyer offering a free consultation by clicking the tab "contact this lawyer now" across from my name.

I agree with attorney Nutt. Schedule an appointment with an experienced bankruptcy attorney and have them evaluate your situation. Many people have a misconception that chapter 7 bankruptcy is "easy" and doesn't require legal representation. Don't make that mistake. For goodness sake you've got $40,000! Allocate a portion of that toward hiring an attorney to represent you.

The answer to this question requires an assessment of your entire financial situation. Equity in what? Does this cause any issues in regard to means test income - "this" meaning the settlement? Depends on what you earn. There are not enough facts to parse out an isolated answer to these two questions. Why don't you take advantage of a free consultation and have your entire situation assessed before you jump.
